Body:
Description: Tested this specifically with the "Job Viewer" role so far, but this may affect other roles.

While the Settings dropdown is locked down to what a user can access, if they click the top-level option for settings, they are able to bypass the settings available to them and can change things like their role (can escalate up to anything but Admin), connection profile, and storage profiles, etc.

Steps to Reproduce Updated: 1. Set up RBA and assign user a low access level role (ie Job Viewer)
2. Login to the console as the user
3. Select Settings from the left-hand pane in NEA
4. In the right-hand page, select any option not available in the dropdown under Settings
5. In the access tab, a user can escalate there permissions to anything but Admin
What We've Learned Updated: qualified this risk in multiple support labs.
Next Steps Updated: R&D to publish fix
